lexUnit.name: empty.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: make a location or container empty, remove the contents of a container

sentence.text: He had emptied their pockets and thrown away their hope .
As an afterthought , Ellwood emptied the priest 's pockets , then scrambled back on to the rock and pushed Carey 's belongings in between the boulders along with his own clothing .
Anyway " he emptied the suitcase full of notes onto the floor `
A man sitting at a three-legged stool emptied a dustpan full of rubbish over his suit and then removed it with a battery powered mini vacuum cleaner .
A Building Society cashier had a gun pointed at her head while robbers emptied the office safe .
As soon as they had emptied their tiny cups of black coffee , Nathan had settled the bill and they had walked quickly back down the hill to the waterfront .
Unfortunately , this would be to empty the term of most of the meanings which it carries in actual discourse .
The values of justice and equality would lead to the setting up of bureaucracies which would empty the world of sacred meanings .
But the next moment Holmes had emptied his revolver into the hound 's body .
If someone empties their in-tray into yours , protest .

Hugh 's mother emptied her shopping-bag onto the carpet and Gina had the feeling of terror that wedding-presents had sometimes brought ; she wondered what on earth would happen if something went wrong .
Take a sheet of paper before going in to any negotiation and empty your mind onto the sheet of paper .
Paupers engaged in emptying the cesspools during the night were allowed one pint of beer , 7 ozs. bread and 1 oz. cheese .
Patients were asked to empty their bladder before going to bed , noting the precise time and discarding the urine .
Neither knew who had emptied the desk .
During the summer the " Bolshie outing " as it was known , practically emptied the village .
A cess pool has to be airtight , and installed where it can be readily emptied by pumps and motor tankers from time to time .
It was only shipped up to Paris recently when the house had been emptied of furniture .
Your tin was emptied , the tobacco replaced .
Pails were emptied from upper windows , making their way hazardous .
He emptied his cup and set it down on the table .
Beneath each window were long encrusted brown stains , stretching to the ground , where the monks over the centuries had emptied their latrine buckets .
